Package ohos.agp.render.opengl

Class GLES20

  • java.lang.Object
    • ohos.agp.render.opengl.GLES20
  • Direct Known Subclasses:
    GLES30

    public class GLES20
extends Object
    Represents the GLES2.0 interface.
    Since:
    3

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field Description
      static int GL_ACTIVE_TEXTURE
      Indicates the active texture unit.
      static int GL_ALWAYS
      Indicates that deep testing can always be passed.
      static int GL_ARRAY_BUFFER
      Indicates the target binding buffer object used for vertex attributes.
      static int GL_BACK
      Indicates that only the back left and back right color buffers are written.
      static int GL_BLEND
      Indicates the blend mode which can combine the source and destination colors of each output in a variety of ways.
      static int GL_CCW
      Indicates that face culling is performed in a counter clockwise direction.
      static int GL_CLAMP_TO_EDGE
      Indicates that the color of the texture edge is used at the texture borders.
      static int GL_COLOR_ATTACHMENT0
      Indicates that OpenGL binds the texture object to FBO binding point 0.
      static int GL_COLOR_BUFFER_BIT
      Indicates the buffers currently enabled for color writing.
      static int GL_COMPILE_STATUS
      Indicates a shader compiler status which causes params return a boolean value.
      static int GL_CULL_FACE
      Indicates that the face culling function can be turned on.
      static int GL_CW
      Indicates that face culling is performed in a clockwise direction.
      static int GL_DELETE_STATUS
      Indicates a shader delete status which causes params return a boolean value.
      static int GL_DEPTH_ATTACHMENT
      Indicates that the texture is bound to the FBO as a depth attachment.
      static int GL_DEPTH_BUFFER_BIT
      Indicates that the depth values of all pixels are set to the maximum value.
      static int GL_DEPTH_COMPONENT16
      Indicates that this is an internal format for depth texture data, where each texture unit contains 16 bits.
      static int GL_DEPTH_TEST
      Indicates that the function of updating the depth buffer is enabled when it is started.
      static int GL_FLOAT
      Indicates a floating-point value.
      static int GL_FRAGMENT_SHADER
      Indicates the Fragment Shader, which is the OpenGL pipeline stage after a primitive is rasterized.
      static int GL_FRAMEBUFFER
      Indicates the frame buffer type.
      static int GL_FRAMEBUFFER_COMPLETE
      Indicates that the operation type for using the frame buffer is ready.
      static int GL_FRONT
      Indicates that only the front left and front right color buffers are written and if there is no front right color buffer, only the front left color buffer is written.
      static int GL_INVALID_VALUE
      Indicates that it is given when a value parameter is not a legal value for that function.
      static int GL_KEEP
      Indicates that keep existing mask values.
      static int GL_LEQUAL
      Indicates that it passes if the incoming depth value is less than or equal to the stored depth value.
      static int GL_LESS
      Indicates that pass if the incoming depth value is less than the stored depth value.
      static int GL_LINE_LOOP
      Indicates the primitive for drawing a line loop.
      static int GL_LINE_STRIP
      Indicates the primitive for drawing a line strip.
      static int GL_LINEAR
      Indicates that a weighted average of four colors close to the center of the pixel being textured is used as the final texture value.
      static int GL_LINEAR_MIPMAP_LINEAR
      Indicates that GL_LINEAR is used to generate texture values for the two mipmaps that most closely match the size of the pixel being textured, and a weighted average of the two texture values is used as the final texture value.
      static int GL_LINES
      Indicates the primitive for drawing lines.
      static int GL_LINK_STATUS
      Indicates the last link operation status on program.
      static int GL_MAX_TEXTURE_SIZE
      Indicates a rough estimate of the maximum size of Texture that OpenGL can handle.
      static int GL_NEAREST
      Indicates that the color of the pixel that is closest to the texture coordinates is used as the color of the pixel to be drawn.
      static int GL_NICEST
      Indicates that the most correct, or highest quality, option should be chosen.
      static int GL_NO_ERROR
      Indicates that no error has been recorded.
      static int GL_NONE
      Indicates that the fragment shader output value is not written into any color buffer.
      static int GL_ONE
      Indicates that 1.0 is used as a factor, which is equivalent to the full use of this color in the blending operation.
      static int GL_ONE_MINUS_SRC_ALPHA
      Indicates that the factor is 1.0 minus the alpha value of the source color.
      static int GL_POINTS
      Indicates the primitive for drawing points.
      static int GL_RENDERBUFFER
      Indicates the rendering buffer type.
      static int GL_RENDERER
      Indicates that it used to return the name of the renderer.
      static int GL_REPEAT
      Indicates the repetition mode in texture wrapper mode.
      static int GL_REPLACE
      Indicates that the current template value is replaced with the value specified in the test condition.
      static int GL_RGB
      Indicates the format of the pixel data, which consists of red, green, and blue triplets.
      static int GL_RGBA
      Indicates the each element containing all four components.
      static int GL_SAMPLER_2D
      Indicates the 2D shader type.
      static int GL_SHADER_COMPILER
      Indicates that params returns a single boolean value indicating whether a shader compiler is supported.
      static int GL_SRC_ALPHA
      Indicates that the alpha value of the source color is used as the factor.
      static int GL_STATIC_DRAW
      Indicates the data store contents will be modified once and used many times as the source for GL drawing commands.
      static int GL_STENCIL_ATTACHMENT
      Indicates when the texture is bound to the FBO as a template attachment.
      static int GL_STENCIL_TEST
      Indicates that about mask settings properties.
      static int GL_TEXTURE_2D
      Indicates the 2D texture type.
      static int GL_TEXTURE_MAG_FILTER
      Indicates that the pixel being textured represents an area larger than the loaded pixel.
      static int GL_TEXTURE_MIN_FILTER
      Indicates that the pixel being textured represents an area smaller than the loaded pixel.
      static int GL_TEXTURE_WRAP_S
      Indicates that the texture border is outside the range of the texture coordinate S.
      static int GL_TEXTURE_WRAP_T
      Indicates that the texture border is outside the range of the texture coordinate T.
      static int GL_TEXTURE0
      Indicates the default texture unit.
      static int GL_TEXTURE1
      Indicates the second texture unit starting from GL_TEXTURE0.
      static int GL_TEXTURE3
      Indicates the fourth texture unit starting from GL_TEXTURE0.
      static int GL_TRIANGLE_FAN
      Indicates the primitive for drawing a triangle fan.
      static int GL_TRIANGLE_STRIP
      Indicates the primitive for drawing a triangle strip.
      static int GL_TRIANGLES
      Indicates the primitive for drawing triangles.
      static int GL_TRUE
      Indicates the boolean value of true.
      static int GL_UNPACK_ALIGNMENT
      Indicates that about texture settings properties.
      static int GL_UNSIGNED_BYTE
      Indicates the red channels of adjacent pixels are separated by three bytes.
      static int GL_UNSIGNED_SHORT
      Indicates an unsigned 16-bit integer.
      static int GL_VALIDATE_STATUS
      Indicates the validate status.
      static int GL_VENDOR
      Indicates that return the company responsible for this GL implementation.
      static int GL_VERSION
      Indicates that it used to return a version or release number.
      static int GL_VERTEX_SHADER
      Indicates the Vertex Shader, which is the programmable Shader stage in the rendering pipeline that handles the processing of individual vertices.
      static int GL_ZERO
      Indicates that using 0.0 as a factor is in effect equivalent to not using this color in the blending operation.

      • glClear

        public static void glClear​(int mask)
        Clears a module in the buffer based on a specified mask.
        Parameters:
        mask - Indicates the mask specifying the module to be cleared from the buffer, which is determined by bitwise OR of the mask. The masks GL_COLOR_BUFFER_BIT, GL_DEPTH_BUFFER_BIT, GL_ACCUM_BUFFER_BIT, and GL_STENCIL_BUFFER_BIT map onto the color, depth, accumulation, and stencil buffers, respectively.

      • glTexParameteri

        public static void glTexParameteri​(int target,
                                   int pName,
                                   int param)
        Maps a texture image onto an image space in the frame buffer.
        Parameters:
        target - Indicates the target to which the active texture will be bound. Example values are GL_TEXTURE_1D and GL_TEXTURE_2D.
        pName - Indicates the name of a texture parameter, such as GL_TEXTURE_MIN_FILTER and GL_TEXTURE_MAG_FILTER.
        param - Indicates the value of the texture parameter. For example, the value of the text parameter GL_TEXTURE_MIN_FILTER can be GL_LINEAR or GL_NEAREST.

        internalFormat - Specifies the internal format to use for the renderbuffer object's image.
        width - Specifies the width of the renderbuffer in pixels.
        height - Specifies the height of the renderbuffer in pixels.

      • glReadPixels

        public static void glReadPixels​(int x,
                                int y,
                                int width,
                                int height,
                                int format,
                                int type,
                                Buffer data)
        This method is used to read a block of pixels from the frame buffer.
        Parameters:
        x - Specify the window coordinates of the first pixel that is read from the frame buffer. This location is the lower left corner of a rectangular block of pixels.
        y - Specify the window coordinates of the first pixel that is read from the frame buffer. This location is the lower left corner of a rectangular block of pixels.
        width - Specify the width of the pixel rectangle.
        height - Specify the height of the pixel rectangle.
        format - Specifies the format of the pixel data.
        type - Specifies the data type of the pixel data.

      • glTexImage2D

        public static void glTexImage2D​(int target,
                                int level,
                                int internalFormat,
                                int width,
                                int height,
                                int border,
                                int format,
                                int type,
                                Buffer data)
        This method is used to specify a two-dimensional texture image.
        Parameters:
        target - Specifies the target texture.
        level - Specifies the level-of-detail number. Level 0 is the base image level. Level n is the nth mipmap reduction image
        internalFormat - Specifies the number of color components in the texture.
        width - Specifies the width of the texture image.
        height - Specifies the height of the texture image, or the number of layers in a texture array.
        border - This value must be 0.
        format - Specifies the format of the pixel data.
        type - Specifies the data type of the pixel data.
        data - Specifies a pointer to the image data in memory.

      • glStencilFuncSeparate

        public static void glStencilFuncSeparate​(int face,
                                         int func,
                                         int ref,
                                         int mask)
        This method is used to set front and/or back function and reference value for stencil testing.
        Parameters:
        face - Specifies whether front and/or back stencil state is updated.
        func - Specifies the test function.
        ref - Specifies the reference value for the stencil test.
        mask - Specifies a mask that is ANDed with both the reference value and the stored stencil value when the test is done.
        Since:
        4

                                         int mask)

      • glStencilOpSeparate

        public static void glStencilOpSeparate​(int face,
                                       int sFail,
                                       int dpFail,
                                       int dpPass)
        This method is used to set front and/or back stencil test actions.
        Parameters:
        face - Specifies whether front and/or back stencil state is updated.
        sFail - Specifies the action to take when the stencil test fails.
        dpFail - Specifies the stencil action when the stencil test passes, but the depth test fails.
        dpPass - Specifies the stencil action when both the stencil test and the depth test pass, or when the stencil test passes and either there is no depth buffer or depth testing is not enabled.

                                      int count,
                                      boolean transpose,
                                      float[] value)
        This method is used to specifies the value of the Uniform variable for the current program object.
        Parameters:
        location - Specifies an array pointer with count values to update the specified uniform variable.
        count - Indicates the number of elements to change. If the target uniform variable is not an array, this value should be set to 1. If the value is an array, the value must be greater than or equal to 1.
        transpose - Indicates whether to transpose the matrix as the value of the uniform variable.
        value - Pointer to count elements to update the specified uniform variable.

      • glTexSubImage2D

        public static void glTexSubImage2D​(int target,
                                   int level,
                                   int xoffset,
                                   int yoffset,
                                   int width,
                                   int height,
                                   int format,
                                   int type,
                                   Buffer pixels)
        This method is used to return the value or values of a selected parameter.
        Parameters:
        target - Specifies the target texture of the active texture unit.
        level - Specifies the verbose level number. Level 0 is the basic image level. Level n is the nth mipmap zoom-out image.
        xoffset - Pixel offset in the x direction in the texture array. The x direction indicates the texture coordinate, that is, the lower left corner is (0, 0).
        yoffset - Indicates the texture offset in the y direction in the texture array. The y direction indicates the texture coordinate, that is, the lower left corner is (0, 0).
        width - Specifies the pixel width of the texture subimage.
        height - Specifies the pixel height of the texture subimage.
        format - Specifies the format of pixel data.
        type - Specifies the data type of pixel data.
        pixels - Specifies a pointer to image data in memory.
        Since:
        4

      • glIsShader

        public static boolean glIsShader​(int shader)

        Parameters:
